task.title: Setting up a Floating License Server Running as a Standalone Process
task.shortdesc: Setting up the floating license server.

fig.title: Floating License Server Running as a Standalone Process

step.cmd: Download the license server installation kit for your platform from one of the download URLs included in the registration email message with your floating license key.
step.info: The license server installation may be in the form of a zip archive or an executable file.

step.cmd: Install the license server with admin rights.

choices.choice:
Executable file method
Run the license server executable file.
Follow the prompts.

Zip Archive method
Unzip the installation kit into a new folder.
Start the server using the startup script.The startup script is called licenseServer.bat for Windows and licenseServer.sh for OS X and Unix / Linux. It has 2 parameters:
licenseDir - The path of the directory where the license files will be placed. Default value: license.
port - The TCP port number used to communicate with instances. Default value: 12346.

info.p: The zip archive can be used for running the license server on any platform where a Java virtual machine can run (Windows, OS X, Linux / Unix, etc).

If you use the zip archive on Windows you have to run the scripts provided in the archive for installing, starting, stopping, and uninstalling the server as a Windows service. The Windows installer installs the license server as a Windows service. It provides the following optional features that are not available in the other license server installers:

ul.li: Start the Windows service automatically at Windows startup.
Create shortcuts on the Start menu for starting and stopping the Windows service manually.

step.cmd: The license folder must contain a text file called license.txt that must contain a single floating license key corresponding to the set of purchased floating licenses.

info.note: If you have more than one floating license key for the same version, or you want to split a set of license keys between 2 different servers, please contact us at support@oxygenxml.com to merge / split your license keys.
